job description:
Description:
The Business Analyst will work with customers and engineers to capture new customer demand, document their requirements, validate assumptions and acceptance criteria, look at sample data, and derive technical requirements. The goal of the business analyst is to enable the development team to quickly pick up new requirements and move quickly to implement them without having to ask many additional questions or go back to the original customer for clarification.

This team is ingesting, centralizing, and transporting global data from around the world into the cyber data lake. This team will comprise of one Project Manager, 3-4 Data Schema BAs ("Business Data Analysts"), and 5-6 Python/Spark developers ("Pipeline Developers"). The developers will be developing new ETL libraries or applications on top of the data lake platform that will perform machine learning functions. They need to have experience with ETL and parsing systems, as well as parsing and transforming data. The BAs will work with developers and various teams to extrapolate the value out of the data that's being ingested into the data lake. They will be translating machine data that can be used for multiple purposes.

Qualifications:
  • 10+ years working as a business analyst, data analyst, systems engineer or systems architect
  • 5+ years working in a big data or data warehouse context, ideally using a Hadoop cluster
  • 5+ years working with ETL tools like Informatica
  • 5+ years working with an Agile tracking tool, ideally Jira
  • 5+ years working with a Wiki tool, ideally Confluence
